page.title: 01Our D-Block
page.content: Hythe is one of the historic{Cinque {Ports}being found on the South-east coast of Kent; about four miles from {Folkestone}to the east and with {Dungeness}to the west. {The Church of {St. Leonards}high to the north of Hythe overlooks this quaint seaside resort which mercifully is free from the onward march of the slot machine and ubiquitous fair ground. Between the beach and the shopping area is the {Royal Military Canal,}built for the defence of Britain during the {Napoleonic War. In times past, Hythe was reknowned for smuggling. In consequence, there were a number of pubs built in connection with this. Every two years, Hythe holds the {Venetian Fete}on the{Royal Military {Canal}which is opened by the{Mayor of {Hythe.
